commit_message:
Removed fuel-agent package from nailgun.spec

Fuel Agent is to be moved into a separate git
repository. So, this spec is going to be there
and will be checked out during ISO building
together with source Fuel Agent code.

Change-Id: I483ebabc6147d3f9459672d61ebfa94dc446516c
Implements: bp split-fuel-web-repo

commit_message:
Add errors=panic to rootfs

* Add errors=panic to rootfs in order to panic and
not to go to 'ro' when there are any errors on the disk
* Set parameter kernel.panic in sysctl to 60 (By default,
the kernel will not reboot after a panic, but this option
will cause a kernel reboot after 60 seconds.)

Doc-Impact

Change-Id: Iba70f5dc187ca829fdfabb12288f5b56ac6ee233
Closes-Bug: 1371689

commit_message:
Add errors=panic to rootfs

* Add errors=panic to rootfs in order to panic and
not to go to 'ro' when there are any errors on the disk
* Set parameter kernel.panic in sysctl to 60 (By default,
the kernel will not reboot after a panic, but this option
will cause a kernel reboot after 60 seconds.)

Doc-Impact

Change-Id: Ib24f13d3cbbf792e7ee81a9b4054e084f4ec1b5e
Closes-Bug: 1371689

conditional resource plugin availability.

I found its good to organize this code better by adding
str_key for each key defined in the service_types
so that we no longer have to depend on the index when

Change-Id: I352525cce991f664abb28df9569d498cd44baf18
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor Adding service_types to client_plugins

As part of the review https://review.openstack.org/#/c/192529
service_types was added to client_plugins to support the
conditional resource plugin availability.

I found its good to organize this code better by adding
str_key for each key defined in the service_types
so that we no longer have to depend on the index when
multiple service_types are available for a client plugin.

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-07-15 10:21:05.000000000', 'files': ['reference/tags/release_cycle-with-intermediary.rst', 'reference/tags/type_service.rst', 'reference/tags/release_cycle-with-milestones.rst', 'reference/tags/vulnerability_managed.rst', 'reference/tag-template.rst', 'reference/tags/team_diverse-affiliation.rst', 'reference/tags/release_has-stable-branches.rst', 'reference/tags/tc-approved-release.rst', 'reference/tags/release_none.rst', 'reference/tags/type_library.rst', 'reference/tags/release_independent.rst', 'reference/tags/compute_starter_kit.rst', 'reference/tags/release_managed.rst'], 'message': "No longer support attributes in tags

This postulates that tags should be tags, and therefore shouldn't
have attributes.

Attributes in tags were originally meant to hold additional
information on the area described by the tag. However, ideally
tags are self-contained units of information, with an opinionated
description (and ideally an objective set of application rules).
Keeping the option of having attributes in tags adds useless format
complexity and steers tags in the direction of structured project
metadata. Project structured metadata (like the ops-data) is fine,
it's just not the same thing as tags. Continuing to support
attributes in tags IMHO encourages the confusion between the two.

The integrated-release tag was the only one using attributes,
and it's now removed.

Change-Id: I1dd5c8090405bd87e8947892d78c62509258e363
"}]
commit_message:
No longer support attributes in tags

This postulates that tags should be tags, and therefore shouldn't
have attributes.

Attributes in tags were originally meant to hold additional
information on the area described by the tag. However, ideally
tags are self-contained units of information, with an opinionated
description (and ideally an objective set of application rules).
Keeping the option of having attributes in tags adds useless format
complexity and steers tags in the direction of structured project
metadata. Project structured metadata (like the ops-data) is fine,
it's just not the same thing as tags. Continuing to support
attributes in tags IMHO encourages the confusion between the two.

The integrated-release tag was the only one using attributes,
and it's now removed.

Change-Id: I1dd5c8090405bd87e8947892d78c62509258e363

commit_message:
JSCS Cleanup - use $apply instead of $digest in help-panel spec

As recommended by eslint rules, changed the spec for
help-panel to use $apply instead of $digest.
Also, added Apache License for the JS files.

Partially-Implements: blueprint jscs-cleanup

Initial implementation for Nailgun plugins

Implements blueprint nailgun-plugins

Added plugin middleware for custom plugin URLs processing

Added multiple stevedore hooks for plugins to override

commit_message:
Fix display of new line in notifications for Fuel UI

The root cause is excess backslash in bash scripts,
which is interpreted as escape character.

Change-Id: I5a03853a273c6c7413d4c77c1ee122286387bd9e
Closes-Bug: #1467893

commit_message:
Fix failures introduced by the new version of mock

There were calls to non-existent assert's that were silently passing;
there a number of tests that were poorly mocked and have been fixed.

Other tests were clearly just change detector and were removed altogether.

Change-Id: I66ca5140a2dfcb57bf074a7f6d33b97d34cd968b

commit_message:
Make update behavior consistent

Keep behavior of updating workflow consistent with that of workbook and
environment. The update command will fail if the workflow doesn't exist.

Closes-Bug: #1418545

* undefined or null values go last

subject: Add --installroot for yumdownloader to avoid evaluating system packages
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3009, 'name': 'Vladimir Kozhukalov', 'email': 'kozhukalov@gmail.com', 'username': 'kozhukalov'}, {'_account_id': 8777, 'name': 'Roman Vyalov', 'email': 'rvyalov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'r0mikiam'}, {'_account_id': 8789, 'name': 'Dmitry Pyzhov', 'email': 'dpyzhov+gerrit@mirantis.com', 'username': 'dpyzhov'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9582, 'name': 'Dmitry Burmistrov', 'email': 'burmistrovda@gmail.com', 'username': 'dburmistrov'}, {'_account_id': 13194, 'name': 'Alexei Sheplyakov', 'email': 'asheplyakov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'asheplyakov'}, {'_account_id': 13895, 'name': 'Artem Silenkov', 'email': 'asilenkov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'asilenkov'}, {'_account_id': 14090, 'name': 'Igor Raits', 'email': 'i.gnatenko.brain@gmail.com', 'username': 'ignatenkobrain'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-01-15 10:18:11.000000000', 'files': ['mirror/centos/repo.mk'], 'message': "Add --installroot for yumdownloader to avoid evaluating system packages

When I'm trying build ISO under Fedora I have conflicts like:
Package: python-netaddr-0.7.12-6.2.mira1.x86_64 (proprietary)
    Requires: python(abi) = 2.6
    Installed: python-2.7.5-15.fc20.x86_64 (@updates)
        python(abi) = 2.7
        python(abi) = 2.7
    Installed: python3-3.3.2-18.fc20.x86_64 (@updates)
        python(abi) = 3.3
    Available: python-2.6.6-52.el6.x86_64 (proprietary)
        python(abi) = 2.6
It's because yumdownloader reads host RPMDB.

Change-Id: Ie7a70f3fd6f5098b97e3063c5cb32376a01d6843
Partial-Bug: #1396618
blueprint build-iso-on-fedora

commit_message:
Add --installroot for yumdownloader to avoid evaluating system packages

When I'm trying build ISO under Fedora I have conflicts like:
Package: python-netaddr-0.7.12-6.2.mira1.x86_64 (proprietary)
    Requires: python(abi) = 2.6
    Installed: python-2.7.5-15.fc20.x86_64 (@updates)
        python(abi) = 2.7
        python(abi) = 2.7
    Installed: python3-3.3.2-18.fc20.x86_64 (@updates)
        python(abi) = 3.3
    Available: python-2.6.6-52.el6.x86_64 (proprietary)
        python(abi) = 2.6
It's because yumdownloader reads host RPMDB.

Change-Id: Ie7a70f3fd6f5098b97e3063c5cb32376a01d6843
Partial-Bug: #1396618
blueprint build-iso-on-fedora
Signed-off-by: Igor Gnatenko <ignatenko@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Switch periodic tasks to the Futurist library

Futurist is a new Oslo library providing tools for writing asynchronous code.
This spec suggests switching our periodic task implementation to Futurist to
solve some long-standing problems.

https://github.com/openstack/futurist

Change-Id: Ia23fbf595001247b6e4436429caa1ed7842695b7

subject: Huawei manila driver support smartcache and smartpartition
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-15 08:44:33.000000000', 'files': ['manila/share/drivers/huawei/huawei_utils.py', 'manila/share/drivers/huawei/v3/connection.py', 'manila/share/drivers/huawei/v3/helper.py', 'manila/share/drivers/huawei/v3/smartx.py', 'manila/share/drivers/huawei/constants.py', 'manila/tests/share/drivers/huawei/test_huawei_nas.py'], 'message': 'Huawei manila driver support smartcache and smartpartition

Manila "share types" may contain qualified extra-specs -
extra-specs that have significance only for the backend driver
and which are reported back to the scheduler.

This commit adds the following qualified extra-specs:
  * capabilities:smartcache='<is> True'
    smartcache:cachename=test_cache_name
  * capabilities:smartpartition='<is> True'
    smartpartition:partitionname=test_partition_nmae

Implements blueprint huawei-driver-support-smartcache-smartpartition

Change-Id: Ia265e7e90a5a5312952a0431375985097c6eb418
'}]
commit_message:
Huawei manila driver support smartcache and smartpartition

Manila "share types" may contain qualified extra-specs -
extra-specs that have significance only for the backend driver
and which are reported back to the scheduler.

This commit adds the following qualified extra-specs:
  * capabilities:smartcache='<is> True'
    smartcache:cachename=test_cache_name
  * capabilities:smartpartition='<is> True'
    smartpartition:partitionname=test_partition_nmae

Implements blueprint huawei-driver-support-smartcache-smartpartition

Change-Id: Ia265e7e90a5a5312952a0431375985097c6eb418

commit_message:
Add specific error information when createBackup is not supported

Currently when a user calls createBackup on a volume backed instance the
error returned is "The request is invalid". This message could be more
detailed to help users understand what went wrong.

Change-Id: I496a75c5122ffe9ba2a375c3d2ff97eb375b43ac
Closes-bug:#1460887

Currently gre/vxlan type drivers have specific sync_allocations
implementations to perform the same feature. This change abstracts
(vxlan) implementation and moves it to TunnelTypeDriver[1] in order to
share implementation between gre/vxlan; this change also adds some
unittests.

Current gre/vxlan and new implementations of sync_allocations are not
Galera-compliant with multi-writers, a follow-up will update it to
fully support Galera.

[1] neutron.plugins.ml2.drivers.type_tunnel

Change-Id: I188a7cf718d811084475f6783d844588de5d60ea
'}]
commit_message:
Abstract sync_allocations

Currently gre/vxlan type drivers have specific sync_allocations
implementations to perform the same feature. This change abstracts
(vxlan) implementation and moves it to TunnelTypeDriver[1] in order to
share implementation between gre/vxlan; this change also adds some
unittests.

Current gre/vxlan and new implementations of sync_allocations are not
Galera-compliant with multi-writers, a follow-up will update it to
fully support Galera.

[1] neutron.plugins.ml2.drivers.type_tunnel

Change-Id: I188a7cf718d811084475f6783d844588de5d60ea

commit_message:
Remove cinder from starter-kit:compute

In keeping with the concept of expanding a basic compute cloud through
non-disruptive additions, cinder is additional functionality that can be
reasonably added as a next step in making the cloud do more things.

Change-Id: If4b9b94867e093c27c1e2b67dc7c47f43afc907a

subject: tox.ini: Disable python3 tests failing due to Routes < 2.0
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-15 05:16:15.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "tox.ini: Disable python3 tests failing due to Routes < 2.0

The recent update of Neutron's requirements.txt made us to
use Routes < 2.0, which is not python3 compatible.
Disable affected tests until python3 compatible version
of Routes gets available again.  Sadly, our list of python3
tests is now empty.

Closes-Bug: #1474266
Change-Id: Ic2eb33d274c434578b221e22bcd1f48622311ee6
"}]
commit_message:
tox.ini: Disable python3 tests failing due to Routes < 2.0

The recent update of Neutron's requirements.txt made us to
use Routes < 2.0, which is not python3 compatible.
Disable affected tests until python3 compatible version
of Routes gets available again.  Sadly, our list of python3
tests is now empty.

Closes-Bug: #1474266
Change-Id: Ic2eb33d274c434578b221e22bcd1f48622311ee6

commit_message:
Fix retrieve_auth_url in case Keystone URL does not contain port.

Sahara calls retrieve_auth_url() to retrieve auth_url from input
uri. However, this function does not work correctly if input uri
does not contain port.

Change-Id: Ic7a65cd36a237d68151936404567c3bd7d068117
Closes-Bug: #1473434
(cherry picked from commit 710ee9b8ad655d70aa70f3ace2a4e81ea8513b33)

commit_message:
Make logic of unit tests responsive to the method names

The two methods, test_authorize_succeeds_for_tenant_name_in_roles and
test_authorize_succeeds_for_tenant_id_in_roles, have names that don't
match what they are testing. tenant_name and tenant_id need to be
switched.

Change-Id: I7cb0a7d2b2111127fd5d6b55f2da6a3eadf2235d

commit_message:
Keystone: do not allow specifying service names

This fixes service cleanup. Keystone resources are only cleaned up if
they have the correct magic prefix, but services were not reliably
created with that prefix.

This also adds some logging that made it easier to discover this
issue, and fixes a few minor typos.

Closes-Bug: #1474322
Change-Id: Ic58271bbc9a84feff4f60229a66e0ca00834a79c

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-04 10:59:12.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/deploy/install-guide.rst', 'ironic/common/pxe_utils.py', 'ironic/tests/test_pxe_utils.py'], 'message': 'Fix chainloading iPXE (undionly.kpxe)

This patch is making the neutron DHCP provider to explicitly check if
the request is coming from iPXE before ACK'ing the PXE request with the
iPXE script (When iPXE is enabled only).

Also, update the documentation that explains how to configure neutron
for iPXE to create the "ipxe" tag based on the DHCP user class or DHCP
option 175 (as before).

Conflicts:
	doc/source/deploy/install-guide.rst

Change-Id: I60f9f515a9bd45aed6b2f6f9165a2f85259b3879
Closes-Bug: #1454332
(cherry picked from commit 4ec47b66602b4eb0b86ffd1fd69b70ef2bf16a25)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix chainloading iPXE (undionly.kpxe)

This patch is making the neutron DHCP provider to explicitly check if
the request is coming from iPXE before ACK'ing the PXE request with the
iPXE script (When iPXE is enabled only).

Also, update the documentation that explains how to configure neutron
for iPXE to create the "ipxe" tag based on the DHCP user class or DHCP
option 175 (as before).

Conflicts:
	doc/source/deploy/install-guide.rst

Change-Id: I60f9f515a9bd45aed6b2f6f9165a2f85259b3879
Closes-Bug: #1454332
(cherry picked from commit 4ec47b66602b4eb0b86ffd1fd69b70ef2bf16a25)

commit_message:
Remove osclients from runner and scenario signature

* Remove from base.Scenario clients and admin_clients
  arguments. In future we will create OpenStackScenario
  subclass that will contain this logic
* Fully remove usage of osclients from runner
* Fix related unit tests

Change-Id: I0769a10bf55ff7440ef46643dbcc8005cdb7523e

Closes-Bug: 1463773

commit_message:
AggregateTypeAffinityFilter multi values

Add AggregateTypeAffinityFilter multi values support
The value of the instance_type metadata entry is
a string that may contain either a single instance_type name or a comma
separated list of instance_type names. e.g. 'm1.nano' or "m1.nano,m1.small"

Change-Id: Ie2298c32d0fb53ba7195d2e276c6f2c1e7704739
Closes-Bug: 1463773

In some cases it might be helpful to force the migration of flavor
data. For example, when operating on a snapshot of a production
database there may be instances in an operating state that would
stop the migration from finishing. Blocking on this will make it
impossible to finish the migrations (once the migrations require
all the data has been migrated).

Change-Id: I4f6c0679b144897f2bfc2fa06bc7c72b25a85fd3
(cherry picked from commit 5f515dda64de7047fbb2fe5c4076874d1f2aa175)

commit_message:
Add support for forcing migrate_flavor_data

In some cases it might be helpful to force the migration of flavor
data. For example, when operating on a snapshot of a production
database there may be instances in an operating state that would
stop the migration from finishing. Blocking on this will make it
impossible to finish the migrations (once the migrations require
all the data has been migrated).

Change-Id: I4f6c0679b144897f2bfc2fa06bc7c72b25a85fd3
(cherry picked from commit 5f515dda64de7047fbb2fe5c4076874d1f2aa175)

subject: Make heat-templates CI passable again - remove py26 job
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4146, 'name': 'Clark Boylan', 'email': 'cboylan@sapwetik.org', 'username': 'cboylan'}, {'_account_id': 4162, 'name': 'Paul Belanger', 'email': 'pabelanger@redhat.com', 'username': 'pabelanger'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 4571, 'name': 'Steve Baker', 'email': 'sbaker@redhat.com', 'username': 'steve-stevebaker'}, {'_account_id': 5241, 'name': 'Martin Magr', 'email': 'mmagr@redhat.com', 'username': 'mmagr'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 8035, 'name': 'Graeme Gillies', 'email': 'ggillies@redhat.com', 'username': 'ggillies'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-13 12:12:47.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Make heat-templates CI passable again - remove py26 job

Python 2.6 CI of heat-templates broke down with new release of mock:

2015-07-10 14:32:17.314 |   File "/home/jenkins/workspace/gate-heat-templates-python26/.tox/py26/lib/python2.6/site-packages/mock/mock.py", line 132
2015-07-10 14:32:17.315 |     _builtins = {name for name in dir(builtins) if not name.startswith('_')}

The Python 2.6 testing has been deprecated for some time [1], so this
commit removes it from heat-templates to make the CI passable again.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2014-November/051551.html

Change-Id: I4fe77a6c10b41644e131cde70534abf992a6f3b3
Closes-Bug: #1473967
'}]
commit_message:
Make heat-templates CI passable again - remove py26 job

Python 2.6 CI of heat-templates broke down with new release of mock:

2015-07-10 14:32:17.314 |   File "/home/jenkins/workspace/gate-heat-templates-python26/.tox/py26/lib/python2.6/site-packages/mock/mock.py", line 132
2015-07-10 14:32:17.315 |     _builtins = {name for name in dir(builtins) if not name.startswith('_')}

The Python 2.6 testing has been deprecated for some time [1], so this
commit removes it from heat-templates to make the CI passable again.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2014-November/051551.html

Change-Id: I4fe77a6c10b41644e131cde70534abf992a6f3b3
Closes-Bug: #1473967

commit_message:
Wait server to be terminated in VolumesV2NegativeTest.

In some cases, it takes some time to delete server. This might
cause the tear down class fail to delete other resource. Wait
the server to be terminated in test case can avoid this failure.

Change-Id: I10e87cf792f90edc2b5db208205c7425f1a6cec5
Closes-Bug: #1471712

commit_message:
Use openstack cli for cinder type creation

This command was commented out so assumedly there used to be a bug. Switch to
OpenStackClient as the cinder CLI doesn't handle v3 auth correctly.

Implements: bp keystonev3
Change-Id: I1acdc04cf04b7056701bdded31ef2a015de5bce3

commit_message:
Use Keystone V3 API for role creation

Always use the V3 API for role creation.

Groups only exist in the v3 identity API and so we must specify
--os-identity-api-version in these commands.

Implements: bp keystonev3
Closes-Bug: #1470668
Change-Id: I5e01d23ebcb5a0c7de56233071a4eb9b16d3b813

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2015-07-14 17:42:21.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/signal_responder.py', 'heat/tests/test_signal.py', 'heat/engine/resources/stack_user.py', 'heat/engine/resources/openstack/heat/software_deployment.py', 'heat/tests/fakes.py', 'heat/tests/generic_resource.py', 'heat/tests/test_software_deployment.py'], 'message': 'Move signals to SignalResponder class

This change relocates the code that creates and deletes heat, swift and
zaqar signals out of SoftwareDeployment and into SignalResponder, as a
first step in making these signals available to all resources. As part of
this change the structure of the Swift URLs was changed to match that of
the SwiftSignal resource.

Change-Id: Id5701b3696b0ab41433a3f158fabce1f36aabe16
Implements: blueprint uniform-resource-signals
'}]
commit_message:
Move signals to SignalResponder class

This change relocates the code that creates and deletes heat, swift and
zaqar signals out of SoftwareDeployment and into SignalResponder, as a
first step in making these signals available to all resources. As part of
this change the structure of the Swift URLs was changed to match that of
the SwiftSignal resource.

Change-Id: Id5701b3696b0ab41433a3f158fabce1f36aabe16
Implements: blueprint uniform-resource-signals

commit_message:
Cleanup quota_class unittest with appropriate request context

For v2.1 quota_class API, all the hard-code permission was deleted.
The quota_class code is un-winded except the policy enforcement at
REST API entrance.

This patch adjusts the request context in the unittest, use non-admin
context for all the v2.1 unittest.

Partially implements bp nova-api-policy-final-part

Change-Id: I0a70c092d572d0989dd6fd7f873638a9570817b7

[{'number': 17, 'created': '2015-07-14 12:43:34.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/fake_policy.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/quota_classes.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/quota_classes.py', 'etc/nova/policy.json', 'nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_quota_classes.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': 'Remove db layer hard-code permission checks for quota_class_create/update

This patch removes db layer hard-code permission checks for
quota_class_create/update.

For v2 API, this patch adds back-comptiable permission checks at REST
API layer.

For v2.1 API, this patch adds new rule for update method.

Partially implements bp nova-api-policy-final-part

SecurityImpact
UpgradeImpact: Due to the db layer permission checks deleted, the policy
rule "os_compute_api:os-quota-class-sets:update" was updated with
a default that match the permission as before. Admin should be notified
to update their policy configuration to keep permission as before.

Change-Id: Icddc7e5cc1c11ab3d272f61a2ef623d3f750030c
'}]
commit_message:
Remove db layer hard-code permission checks for quota_class_create/update

This patch removes db layer hard-code permission checks for
quota_class_create/update.

For v2 API, this patch adds back-comptiable permission checks at REST
API layer.

For v2.1 API, this patch adds new rule for update method.

Partially implements bp nova-api-policy-final-part

SecurityImpact
UpgradeImpact: Due to the db layer permission checks deleted, the policy
rule "os_compute_api:os-quota-class-sets:update" was updated with
a default that match the permission as before. Admin should be notified
to update their policy configuration to keep permission as before.

Change-Id: Icddc7e5cc1c11ab3d272f61a2ef623d3f750030c

commit_message:
Add python-openstackclient to global-requirements

Clients for newer projects are being built as plugins to
python-openstackclient.  These clients have an explicit
dependency on python-openstackclient for them to be meaningful.

Examples:
 https://github.com/stackforge/python-cueclient
 https://github.com/stackforge/python-congressclient

Change-Id: Ic48d1db4343de6c815790b5eba00fe32e2fd4f2b

To do this I had do some changes to existing Xen documentation:

Apply minimal changes to filenames, enabling later addition of
hypervisor support using Xen+libvirt, renaming XenServer files
using git mv
- section_introduction-to-xen.xml > section_hypervisor_xen_xapi.xml
- section_xen-install.xml > section_xapi-install.xml

Change-Id: I6a6de021ef4e5de4fe28aa971411e07b656c969c

commit_message:
Add documentation for Xen via libvirt to config-reference

To do this I had do some changes to existing Xen documentation:

Apply minimal changes to filenames, enabling later addition of
hypervisor support using Xen+libvirt, renaming XenServer files
using git mv
- section_introduction-to-xen.xml > section_hypervisor_xen_xapi.xml
- section_xen-install.xml > section_xapi-install.xml
- section_compute-configure-xen.xml > section_compute-configure-xapi.xml

All XenServer docs can now be identified using xapi in the filename.

Renamed relevant occurances of Xen to XenServer in XenServer docs and
the Hypervisor page and replaced outdated references to Xen.org with
XenProject.org

Changed URL from introduction-to-xen.html to xen_libvirt.html in
doc/common/section_kvm_enable.xml (did not include references in .po
and .pot files in locale, which are autogenerated)

All of the new Xen via Libvirt documentation is in a new page called
section_hypervisor_xen_libvirt.html

Change-Id: I6a6de021ef4e5de4fe28aa971411e07b656c969c
Closes-Bug: #1253565
Signed-off-by: Lars Kurth <lars.kurth@xenproject.org>
Co-Authored-By: Jim Fehlig <jfehlig@suse.com>
Co-Authored-By: Anthony Perard <anthony.perard@citrix.com>

commit_message:
[network-guide] Update provider OVS scenario

Update provider networks with Open vSwitch scenario as
follows:

1) Remove extraneous configuration from neutron and ML2
   configuration on compute nodes.
2) Fix various conventions issues.
3) Generally improve wording and diagrams.

Patch also includes minor fixes to the Linux bridge scenario.

Change-Id: Ie0e32eafdc4eedd67f4c95400faf9f73bc1f844b
Partial-Bug: #1465778
Partial-Bug: #1465783

Since the versions have all just gotten much smaller due

commit_message:
Ensure the the setup.cfg version has an epoch set

Since the versions have all just gotten much smaller due
to the new release scheme we should really be cautious
about this and ensure we correctly set the epoch so that
people that actually use cinder install it correctly after
the version change.

Change-Id: Ib3637a640b63e5f4380224c847a03e4d12289d37

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-01 16:17:47.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/glusterfs.py'], 'message': 'GlusterFS: support extending a volume that has snapshots

GlusterFS driver currently prevents extending a volume that has
snapshots. This patch enables this feature to GlusterFS driver.

Closes-Bug: #1470148
Change-Id: I763b1a84f32277f3efab2382ad144768bee59aa6
'}]
commit_message:
GlusterFS: support extending a volume that has snapshots

GlusterFS driver currently prevents extending a volume that has
snapshots. This patch enables this feature to GlusterFS driver.

Closes-Bug: #1470148
Change-Id: I763b1a84f32277f3efab2382ad144768bee59aa6

from the original plugin api and is not in the current api.

commit_message:
Consider other hardcoded tmp paths

Previously general_hardcoded_tmp plugin was only testing
for hard-coded usage of "/tmp/", however the same issues
can be present on other FHS locations such as /var/tmp/
and /dev/shm.

This change adds these additional locations for
consideration.

Closes-Bug: #1473725
Signed-off-by: Dave Walker (Daviey) <email@daviey.com>
Change-Id: I76f154134e6cc90a1f30c1c5e41c98dd74c13d33

commit_message:
Fix symlinks to config-{internal,external}.sh

Many of these were actually files containing the path to the real
script, instead of being symlinks.

config-{internal,external}.sh files in openvswitch/ovs-base were not
needed and were thus deleted.

Also update minimal-environment-vars.md after symlinks were fixed.

Change-Id: I11c3e735067b1feb83c3184c32333e598fbdf590
Closes-Bug: #1474227

commit_message:
Fixes login failure to Horizon dashboard

This is a temporary workaround to fix a Django error preventing
the Kolla Horizon login, while waiting for a fix upstream.
It is part of a patch created by Matthias Runge <mrunge@redhat.com>
https://review.openstack.org/gitweb?p=openstack%2Fdjango_openstack_auth.git;a=commitdiff;h=adfc494ec17ee43847d7c0c833dad9c178f29358

I've just used the patch for openstack_auth/user.py

Change-Id: I2c2ad0042f9c60a839d8ee9bca904465bee9361f
Closes-bug: #1469284

This commit migrates all the usage of the json library to use jsonutils
from oslo_serialization. On python 3 httplib2 returns a bytes type for
the response body however all the methods in the json library are
expecting str types. We could switch all the uses of json.loads to
encode the input prior to calling json.loads however oslo_serialization
has baked in all dual python version edge conditions around this into
a call compatible lib which is much cleaner.

Change-Id: Icee30fb74db128c77b2c0c27e68b5801bd138cd5
'}]
commit_message:
Switch all uses of json to oslo_serialization

This commit migrates all the usage of the json library to use jsonutils
from oslo_serialization. On python 3 httplib2 returns a bytes type for
the response body however all the methods in the json library are
expecting str types. We could switch all the uses of json.loads to
encode the input prior to calling json.loads however oslo_serialization
has baked in all dual python version edge conditions around this into
a call compatible lib which is much cleaner.

Change-Id: Icee30fb74db128c77b2c0c27e68b5801bd138cd5

commit_message:
Make ceilometer run with mod_wsgi by default

Ceilometer will now use the ENABLE_HTTPD_MOD_WSGI_SERVICES value
to set the default value for CEILOMETER_USE_MOD_WSGI, meaning that
by default the ceilometer api service will run under mod_wsgi.
This is now the recommended mode for deployments.

Depends-On: I2d81f25522ad982657d7f4239bfe66bfb5538295
Depends-On: Ib38177125ddc8e97e74237e9242e2ea09cff28d4
Depends-On: I9e5e792ef43f9a3cdc0b84c73f27b62109ed5d31
Change-Id: I61fcc84d1f841d6ede1539dc4e3bdae5aecc02de

commit_message:
Remove db layer hard-code permission checks for quota_class_get_all_by_name

This patch removes the hard-code permission checks for db call
quota_class_get_all_by_name.

For v2 api, there already have same hard-code permission checks in REST API
layer, so it is back-compatible.

For v2.1 api, to distinguish show and update permission, this patch adds
new rule for show method.

Partially implements bp nova-api-policy-final-part

SecurityImpact
UpgradeImpact: Due to the db layer permission checks deleted, they need
default policy rule instead of that. In this patch,
"os_compute_api:os-quota-class-sets:show" was updated with a default
rule. Admin will be notfied to update their policy configure file to keep
the behavior as before.

Change-Id: I02da6cc8c766e5f43689449ef63121122f537b5b

commit_message:
Simplify parameters for rpc_backend

It is not needed anymore to specify the whole python namespace
for the backends, and in Liberty this option is completely removed
(see https://review.openstack.org/189201).

This patch keeps backwards compatibility with the previous default
parameters.

Change-Id: I5c84def51bcda593c89c3897c52fb4e8e663e121

commit_message:
Return 404 for images in pending_delete status

Currently, glance image-delete and nova image-delete api returns a
403 for images with pending_delete status.

This patch would fix the behavior to return 404 for any image with
the 'deleted' flag set to True.

This only applies to the v1 APIs since the v2 APIs already use the
same flag.

DocImpact
APIImpact
Change-Id: I5e434bb3edd766f330951b72bdd4f0f8fc807edb
Closes-Bug: #1446326

commit_message:
gate-nova-python34 sometimes test failed on test_save_updates_numa_topology

gate-nova-python34 test failed on test_save_updates_numa_topology in
following jenkins build log.
http://logs.openstack.org/19/201019/1/check/gate-nova-python34/1e74b65/console.html

The difference of expected value and actual value two are
nova_object.changes in cells object. They have same element with
different order. This is because of the order of _changed_fields
was not always same. Therefore the two value's order will be different.

Use mock object to patch InstanceNUMATopology object's _to_json function.

Change-Id: Idad2d06ea2d42b123d7460cb78b0954f23c18563
Closes-Bug: 1473949

commit_message:
Add tool to build a doc latex pdf

The sphinx latex generation generates invalid latex that won't compile
when you try to use it.[1][2] This commit adds a helper script to generate
the sphinx latex and then modify it so it'll work. It depends on
ImageMagick convert and sed being available to work.

[1] https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/1907
[2] https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/1959

Change-Id: Id289c10907aaddae2483f18b39063852ec699d66

commit_message:
Update pylint pin to 1.4.4

Neutron uses pylint as part of a voting pep8 job. A pylint
dependency (logilab-common 1.0) released which broke pylint.
The pylint team then released 1.4.4 to fix that.

Change-Id: Ibad8cd2911efbe075ea2629c543f6ce1f216c938

commit_message:
Revert "Implement compare-and-swap for instance update"

This reverts commit 5b4083f8cbbcca18ea5896f06b371e29b244d0e2

There are gate failures spiking with InstanceUpdateConflict
since this merged, the exception isn't being handled like
how UnexpectedTaskStateError would be handled, so we need
to think about this some more before landing it.

Change-Id: I1d2868eac456052a9ce05a7b8c838eff817d89a4
Closes-Bug: #1474550

This commit starts the basic framework for using external plugins in
tempest. It adds a new singleton class to load the plugins once from
stevedore and also provides an interface for different steps in the
tempest execution to use plugins as well as in-tree code.

As part of this an ABC abstract class is created to simplify the
plugin side creation. Eventually the expectation is that this
abstract class will live in tempest-lib. But, for right now while

Change-Id: I8ebabdb4ce9f4d3b3aca375158835f907d5ca315

commit_message:
Add basic external test plugin support to tempest

This commit starts the basic framework for using external plugins in
tempest. It adds a new singleton class to load the plugins once from
stevedore and also provides an interface for different steps in the
tempest execution to use plugins as well as in-tree code.

As part of this an ABC abstract class is created to simplify the
plugin side creation. Eventually the expectation is that this
abstract class will live in tempest-lib. But, for right now while
this feature is still experimental and under development this will
likely change frequently so it'll live in tempest for the time being.

Partially Implements bp external-plugin-interface

Change-Id: I8ebabdb4ce9f4d3b3aca375158835f907d5ca315

commit_message:
Executor docstring & attribute tweaks

Adjust some docstrings to better align with the class
they are attached to. Also changes some docstrings for
the pooled executor (as it is an abstraction on-top of
async executors, and is not tied to threads anymore) and
correctly denote this on its attributes that others can
and are overriding. 

Change-Id: I2eaaeed3aa0ae64eb5c82843381b7518ac508ac1

The default setting of IMAGE_URLS is given in stackrc, while

commit_message:
Remove duplicated setting of IMAGE_URLS from README.md

The default setting of IMAGE_URLS is given in stackrc, while 
tools/xen/README.md will still suggest user to set it in localrc with 
a duplicated value(i.e. http://download.cirros-cloud.net/0.3.4/cirros
-0.3.4-x86_64-uec.tar.gz) and thus causes a conflict of image upload.

Closes-Bug: #1473432

Change-Id: I910e5daa192b4186f93a58790f761ee0f3808cbb

subject: Add FETCHING notification state (not persisted)
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-03-13 23:31:24.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/engines/action_engine/actions/base.py', 'taskflow/examples/simple_linear_listening.out.txt', 'doc/source/notifications.rst', 'taskflow/tests/unit/test_engines.py', 'taskflow/engines/action_engine/actions/task.py', 'taskflow/engines/action_engine/actions/retry.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/test_suspend.py', 'taskflow/states.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/test_retries.py'], 'message': "Add FETCHING notification state (not persisted)

When arguments are being fetched it is useful to
notify others that this is about to happen and then
pass those arguments to listeners of RUNNING/REVERTING
so that they can do things with those arguments (if
they so desire).

This adds a new state notification before RUNNING/REVERTING
that allows users to become aware that arguments are being
retrieved (which depending on the backend and overall
flow complexity may take a while).

New notification keys 'task_arguments' and 'retry_arguments'
are emitted in the RUNNING/REVERTING states that now include
the arguments that will be executed/reverted with (for the
task/retry that is being notified about).

Change-Id: I67303219e7fed472d0cf327efc893c42ff49907f
"}]
commit_message:
Add FETCHING notification state (not persisted)

When arguments are being fetched it is useful to
notify others that this is about to happen and then
pass those arguments to listeners of RUNNING/REVERTING
so that they can do things with those arguments (if
they so desire).

This adds a new state notification before RUNNING/REVERTING
that allows users to become aware that arguments are being
retrieved (which depending on the backend and overall
flow complexity may take a while).

New notification keys 'task_arguments' and 'retry_arguments'
are emitted in the RUNNING/REVERTING states that now include
the arguments that will be executed/reverted with (for the
task/retry that is being notified about).

Change-Id: I67303219e7fed472d0cf327efc893c42ff49907f

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-07-14 19:25:39.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/objects/test_instance.py'], 'message': 'make test_save_updates_numa_topology stable across python versions

test_save_updates_numa_topology has a rather complex nova object to
represent numa. This includes items which are sets, but must be
converted to lists for json. This is not a stable output operation
across all space and time. The mock comparator was failing here some
times because of it.

Instead, we can manually inspect the parameter in question with our
json comparator to ensure that it is correct.

Closes-Bug: #1473949

Change-Id: Ibfa441356d10417e2b1e092826562ad03d8cfd02
'}]
commit_message:
make test_save_updates_numa_topology stable across python versions

test_save_updates_numa_topology has a rather complex nova object to
represent numa. This includes items which are sets, but must be
converted to lists for json. This is not a stable output operation
across all space and time. The mock comparator was failing here some
times because of it.

Instead, we can manually inspect the parameter in question with our
json comparator to ensure that it is correct.

Closes-Bug: #1473949

Change-Id: Ibfa441356d10417e2b1e092826562ad03d8cfd02

commit_message:
Mask passwords in debug log on user password operations

When a user is created, they change their password, or admin
changes their password and debug logging is enabled, the value of
the user's password was logged. The value should be masked.

Change-Id: I07b7441378fb630f01204d6b656b218f6b94dd5a
Closes-Bug: #1465922
(cherry picked from commit fbdb100e656b19958589fa659bf9d95303e76ab8)

commit_message:
Place an accurate lower bound on pbr

Without this version, markers will fail to install in a growing number
of projects.

Change global-requirements to prevent
pip -r requirements.txt; pip install .
failing with an already installed and too old for setup_requires pbr.

Change update.py to signal to setuptools the minimum version required,
giving clearer error messages in the case of downgrades during
devstack.

Change-Id: I074274b470a7a4f2c95211677b135038ab2c942c

subject: Stop adding extra newline after unparseable lines.
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-08 14:37:08.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_requirements/tests/test_update.py', 'openstack_requirements/cmds/update.py'], 'message': "Stop adding extra newline after unparseable lines.

I have a project that includes a requirement line this:

    -e git://git.openstack.org/openstack/neutron.git#egg=neutron

Every time update.py runs against the file, it adds an extra newline
after this.  For example, if I run update.py a few times, I'll have a
few new lines in the file.  This patch prevents the extra newlines
from getting added.

Change-Id: I92d02a45c437025b16df067d7b58a3727d42c0e0
Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Stop adding extra newline after unparseable lines.

I have a project that includes a requirement line this:

    -e git://git.openstack.org/openstack/neutron.git#egg=neutron

Every time update.py runs against the file, it adds an extra newline
after this.  For example, if I run update.py a few times, I'll have a
few new lines in the file.  This patch prevents the extra newlines
from getting added.

Change-Id: I92d02a45c437025b16df067d7b58a3727d42c0e0
Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Bump 1.9.0 to oslo.utils

The fileutils is graduated in the oslo.utils library for the 1.8.0 version.
And The missed write_to_tempfile function was added in the 1.9.0 version.

Implements: blueprint graduate-fileutils

Depends-On: I661dd222da6386a7dbcf854958a63e59b13e9ba4 (oslo.utils)
Change-Id: I51ba9076e1fbc16145ee2311f47b7768c16dcb20

subject: patch open in a context manager instead of decorator
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-14 15:24:22.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/tests/unit/v2/test_shell.py'], 'message': "patch open in a context manager instead of decorator

Because of the test inheritance test_keypair_import is getting called
3 times. It appears that the mock for open builtins is getting torn
down after it's first use, and not correctly built again on subsequent calls.

In the gate, this is a race, because we have 3 tests and 8 workers,
and this will only fail if 2 or more of the tests happen to be
allocated to the same worker. This can be reproduced locally with:

  tox -e py27 -- --concurrency=1

Converting this to the context manager usage of mock appears to
resolve the issue.

Change-Id: I46b50df69ce0c353d2dc221ad0e6484957561bf9
"}]
commit_message:
patch open in a context manager instead of decorator

Because of the test inheritance test_keypair_import is getting called
3 times. It appears that the mock for open builtins is getting torn
down after it's first use, and not correctly built again on subsequent calls.

In the gate, this is a race, because we have 3 tests and 8 workers,
and this will only fail if 2 or more of the tests happen to be
allocated to the same worker. This can be reproduced locally with:

  tox -e py27 -- --concurrency=1

Converting this to the context manager usage of mock appears to
resolve the issue.

Change-Id: I46b50df69ce0c353d2dc221ad0e6484957561bf9

commit_message:
Retain atom 'revert' result (or failure)

When a atom is reverted it can be useful to retain the
result of that 'revert' method being called, so that it
can be later analyzed (or used for various purposes) so
adjust the storage, and actions to enable it to be stored.

Change-Id: I38a9a5f3bf7550e924468bb4a86652cb8beb306c

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-06 23:58:40.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/functional/v3/test_fixed_ips.py'], 'message': 'Modified testscenario for micro version 2.4

Microversion 2.4 adds 'reserved' status in os-fixed-ips.
Currently it's functional tests runs against both v2 (which are skipped)
and v2.1(with version 2.4).

Microversion tests do not need to run  against v2. It should only run for 2.4

This commit fix that by defining testscenario for 2.4 microversion.
Which will make 2.4 microversion tests to run only for 2.4 and by
appending "(2_4)" string in 2.4 tests ids to have clear and readable tests
names for microversion 2.4.

Change-Id: I3638013133f9eddd0c8a53ba63f340861ff9caa1
'}]
commit_message:
Modified testscenario for micro version 2.4

Microversion 2.4 adds 'reserved' status in os-fixed-ips.
Currently it's functional tests runs against both v2 (which are skipped)
and v2.1(with version 2.4).

Microversion tests do not need to run  against v2. It should only run for 2.4

This commit fix that by defining testscenario for 2.4 microversion.
Which will make 2.4 microversion tests to run only for 2.4 and by
appending "(2_4)" string in 2.4 tests ids to have clear and readable tests
names for microversion 2.4.

Change-Id: I3638013133f9eddd0c8a53ba63f340861ff9caa1

subject: Revert "Use ubuntu-trusty for multi-node tests"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-14 23:26:51.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/openstack_functions.py', 'jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'dev/zuul/openstack_functions.py'], 'message': 'Revert "Use ubuntu-trusty for multi-node tests"

This reverts commit 2b5b800d4fc48724da66e72e03812222125d3667. These new
images cannot be reliably uploaded to rackspace which makes iterating on
image updates/fixes very difficult. Switch back to the old image (using
new shorter hostnames) to get multinode working again. We can switch
back when we have uploads sorted out.

Change-Id: I46e051a4a566ae400c2fc153ad72596c853af32c
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Use ubuntu-trusty for multi-node tests"

This reverts commit 2b5b800d4fc48724da66e72e03812222125d3667. These new
images cannot be reliably uploaded to rackspace which makes iterating on
image updates/fixes very difficult. Switch back to the old image (using
new shorter hostnames) to get multinode working again. We can switch
back when we have uploads sorted out.

Change-Id: I46e051a4a566ae400c2fc153ad72596c853af32c

revisions:
[{'number': 36, 'created': '2015-07-14 02:46:02.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/os_heat/tasks/heat_service_add.yml', 'playbooks/library/glance', 'playbooks/roles/os_nova/templates/nova.conf.j2', 'playbooks/roles/os_swift/tasks/swift_service_setup.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_tempest/templates/tempest.conf.j2', 'playbooks/roles/os_glance/tasks/glance_service_setup.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_nova/tasks/nova_service_add.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_neutron/tasks/neutron_service_add.yml', 'playbooks/library/neutron', 'playbooks/roles/os_cinder/tasks/cinder_service_add.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_ceilometer/tasks/ceilometer_service_add.yml', 'playbooks/library/keystone', 'etc/openstack_deploy/user_group_vars.yml', 'playbooks/roles/openstack_openrc/templates/openrc', 'playbooks/roles/os_keystone/defaults/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_keystone/tasks/keystone_service_setup.yml'], 'message': "Upgrade the Keystone library to use v3

In order to enable and deploy federated Keystone, we need to use version
3 of the Keystone API and the v3 Keystone Client. This work begins that
transition by having a set of backwards compatible library commands.

Specifically, this commit updates the keystone library to use v3
Keystone Client and the usage of ensure_tenant in the os_keystone tasks
to use the v3 admin url.

In version 3 of Keystone's Endpoints (Catalog) API each endpoint only
has one URL and has separate interface types (public, internal, admin).
This change updates all uses of ensure_endpoint to structure the
endpoint data in a better way for the ensure_endpoint command in the
keystone module. As a result, some incidents where internalurl and
adminurl were swapped have been fixed.

Note:
In new deployments the endpoints will be created using the v3 API and
will therefore not be available via the v2 API. This will be a breaking
change to legacy CLI clients. The openstack CLI should be used instead.

DocImpact
Related-Bug: #1470635
Partially-implements: blueprint keystone-federation
Change-Id: I2cd4f505e850b4b113452abc25ee00d486b1637d
"}]
commit_message:
Upgrade the Keystone library to use v3

In order to enable and deploy federated Keystone, we need to use version
3 of the Keystone API and the v3 Keystone Client. This work begins that
transition by having a set of backwards compatible library commands.

Specifically, this commit updates the keystone library to use v3
Keystone Client and the usage of ensure_tenant in the os_keystone tasks
to use the v3 admin url.

In version 3 of Keystone's Endpoints (Catalog) API each endpoint only
has one URL and has separate interface types (public, internal, admin).
This change updates all uses of ensure_endpoint to structure the
endpoint data in a better way for the ensure_endpoint command in the
keystone module. As a result, some incidents where internalurl and
adminurl were swapped have been fixed.

Note:
In new deployments the endpoints will be created using the v3 API and
will therefore not be available via the v2 API. This will be a breaking
change to legacy CLI clients. The openstack CLI should be used instead.

DocImpact
Related-Bug: #1470635
Partially-implements: blueprint keystone-federation
Change-Id: I2cd4f505e850b4b113452abc25ee00d486b1637d

subject: Make sure configure-vm mac doesn't start negative
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-16 22:34:38.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/configure-vm'], 'message': "Make sure configure-vm mac doesn't start negative

The original version of this code allowed for the possibility of
generating macs with negative numbers (consider generating 100 macs,
with a random start value of 0xaa).

While this is unlikely to be a problem in real-world uses of this
code, it's still a potential bug if someone starts to push on the
limits of what is supported.

Change-Id: Ia42da0ece5ab3fbeccd6b4d8a4125c1bf5a658d0
"}]
commit_message:
Make sure configure-vm mac doesn't start negative

The original version of this code allowed for the possibility of
generating macs with negative numbers (consider generating 100 macs,
with a random start value of 0xaa).

While this is unlikely to be a problem in real-world uses of this
code, it's still a potential bug if someone starts to push on the
limits of what is supported.

Change-Id: Ia42da0ece5ab3fbeccd6b4d8a4125c1bf5a658d0

commit_message:
ml2: l3 plugin doesn't always has dvr_deletens_if_no_port method

Since dvr_deletens_if_no_port isn't part of l3 interface,
ml2 plugin shouldn't assume that l3 plugin has dvr_deletens_if_no_port
method.
Otherwise it results in attribute error in delete_port method.

Change-Id: I9fd47642409d71082ba39b7f67595f691945bcec
Closes-Bug: #1474265

subject: Use an Anchor when service is managed
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-14 14:51:15.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/type/keystone_service.rb', 'lib/puppet/type/keystone_user_role.rb', 'spec/classes/keystone_spec.rb', 'lib/puppet/type/keystone_tenant.rb', 'manifests/init.pp', 'lib/puppet/type/keystone_role.rb', 'lib/puppet/type/keystone_user.rb', 'lib/puppet/type/keystone_endpoint.rb'], 'message': "Use an Anchor when service is managed

Today, Keystone resources (domains, tenants, etc) are created only if
'keystone' service is started.
When running Keystone in WSGI, the autorequire is broken for those
resources.
Adding 'httpd' in autorequire is not enough because it could fail to
orchestration issues if running another httpd resource (Horizon) that
depends on having Keystone started.

This patch is about to create an Anchor (keystone_started) in
keystone::service that require Service['keystone'] resource to be
created.
In resource types, change the autorequire to depend on the new Anchor.

With that patch, we are sure Keystone resources won't be created before
service is actually managed (running or stopped) and other resources
(Horizon, using httpd server) can also depend on this Anchor if needed.

Change-Id: Ie72b65b6be224cadc8730e050bec38d2face5dfd
Closes-bug: #1474059
(cherry picked from commit c11b0408ef0f2d98749106cabc47c7d0b9268b4c)
"}]
commit_message:
Use an Anchor when service is managed

Today, Keystone resources (domains, tenants, etc) are created only if
'keystone' service is started.
When running Keystone in WSGI, the autorequire is broken for those
resources.
Adding 'httpd' in autorequire is not enough because it could fail to
orchestration issues if running another httpd resource (Horizon) that
depends on having Keystone started.

This patch is about to create an Anchor (keystone_started) in
keystone::service that require Service['keystone'] resource to be
created.
In resource types, change the autorequire to depend on the new Anchor.

With that patch, we are sure Keystone resources won't be created before
service is actually managed (running or stopped) and other resources
(Horizon, using httpd server) can also depend on this Anchor if needed.

Change-Id: Ie72b65b6be224cadc8730e050bec38d2face5dfd
Closes-bug: #1474059
(cherry picked from commit c11b0408ef0f2d98749106cabc47c7d0b9268b4c)

subject: Fix Routes version problem for py3
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-13 13:44:12.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Fix Routes version problem for py3

This patch adds environment marker to the Routes package which has
caused some problems in Nova. Previous version constraints excluded
version 2.1, which effectively forces all projects to use version 1.13
of Routes. However, version 1.13 cannot pass py34 gate. By adding this
marker, we make both py27 and py34 happy while waiting for the next
release from Routes.

Change-Id: I88e78d396af15811a6ed579152955f63ad73691a
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Routes version problem for py3

This patch adds environment marker to the Routes package which has
caused some problems in Nova. Previous version constraints excluded
version 2.1, which effectively forces all projects to use version 1.13
of Routes. However, version 1.13 cannot pass py34 gate. By adding this
marker, we make both py27 and py34 happy while waiting for the next
release from Routes.

Change-Id: I88e78d396af15811a6ed579152955f63ad73691a

commit_message:
[HDP] Nameservice awareness for NNHA case

With the addition of NNHA in Kilo, Oozie continued to be pointed at only
one namenode's IP. This change directs EDP jobs to the nameservice,
which defaults to the cluster's name as sent to HDP.

As it is intended primarily for backport, to allow Sahara's EDP to
function in the NNHA case, this change takes a minimal-path approach to
resolving this issue, which can be supplemented or replaced by a more
robust solution for nameservice configuration and load balancing for all
components as time permits.

Closes-bug: 1470841
(cherry picked from commit aced37e13f1357a44b7d6f8367a4f49f559ad6c7)

Change-Id: I14ccd5b32c68d0f989b12c4485598094e8841474

commit_message:
Fix retrieve_auth_url in case Keystone URL does not contain port.

Sahara calls retrieve_auth_url() to retrieve auth_url from input
uri. However, this function does not work correctly if input uri
does not contain port.

Change-Id: Ic7a65cd36a237d68151936404567c3bd7d068117
Closes-Bug: #1473434

commit_message:
Resolve 500 error during simultaneously deletion

We need to render not found in case if some resource was deleted
to prevent to_wrapped_dict() execution. This patch do that job.

Change-Id: Ie179869bbf15965263cff62bb35740d825b6cabf
Closes-bug: 1463068
(cherry picked from commit 3bfd3ea643502c3cab2c29b2d7ed6ea5e126b4c0)

[{'number': 9, 'created': '2015-07-13 19:24:07.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/monitors/test_monitors.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_resource_tracker.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/monitors/cpu/test_virt_driver.py', 'nova/compute/monitors/__init__.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/monitors/cpu/__init__.py', 'nova/compute/monitors/cpu/virt_driver.py', 'setup.cfg', 'nova/compute/resource_tracker.py'], 'message': 'Use stevedore for loading monitor extensions

The compute monitor plugins were being loaded using the nova.loadables
module. This patch uses the stevedore library to load monitor
extensions. We keep the same semantics as the previous loading
mechanism: we use the CONF.compute_monitors configuration option to
winnow the set of all monitor plugins, and we ensure that no two
monitors that return the same set of metrics will be loaded.

However, this patch deprecates the CONF.compute_available_monitors
configuration option, since stevedore and setuptools entry points now
allow a set of plugins to be specified without any further configuration
options.

Change-Id: I97bf8bcd43faf9f3fe40983497c2360233d5f599
Fixes-bug: 1468012
DocImpact: deprecates the CONF.compute_available_monitors option.
'}]
commit_message:
Use stevedore for loading monitor extensions

The compute monitor plugins were being loaded using the nova.loadables
module. This patch uses the stevedore library to load monitor
extensions. We keep the same semantics as the previous loading
mechanism: we use the CONF.compute_monitors configuration option to
winnow the set of all monitor plugins, and we ensure that no two
monitors that return the same set of metrics will be loaded.

However, this patch deprecates the CONF.compute_available_monitors
configuration option, since stevedore and setuptools entry points now
allow a set of plugins to be specified without any further configuration
options.

Change-Id: I97bf8bcd43faf9f3fe40983497c2360233d5f599
Fixes-bug: 1468012
DocImpact: deprecates the CONF.compute_available_monitors option.

subject: Add excludes support for create-zanata-xml
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-13 05:46:43.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/scripts/ZanataUtils.py', 'jenkins/scripts/create-zanata-xml.py', 'jenkins/scripts/common_translation_update.sh'], 'message': "Add excludes support for create-zanata-xml

For projects such as Manuals and Horizon, the source directory in
zanata.xml is set to '.', which may have the unintended side-effect
of the Zanata client finding .po or .pot files under dot directories.
Add a new option to create-zanata-xml, and use it for those two
projects.

Change-Id: I5fc26069c288eca130a45c6e9c5e3dd00ad2c784
"}]
commit_message:
Add excludes support for create-zanata-xml

For projects such as Manuals and Horizon, the source directory in
zanata.xml is set to '.', which may have the unintended side-effect
of the Zanata client finding .po or .pot files under dot directories.
Add a new option to create-zanata-xml, and use it for those two
projects.

Change-Id: I5fc26069c288eca130a45c6e9c5e3dd00ad2c784

commit_message:
Fix Create User form's fields sorting for Django 1.7

Starting from Django 1.7 self.fields.keyOrder no longer works for
setting fields ordering, need to rearrange fields there by recreating
underlying OrderedDict.

Change-Id: If0f4c7014a7a68f2ff0d0f2cb06f7b1c2e28436b
Closes-Bug: #1465221
(cherry picked from commit d2f9b6604cbfbf3dc5c0328e783e27b3ef1a4e37)

subject: Fix TemplateSyntaxError at hypervisors view
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-10 11:46:41.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/hypervisors/compute/tabs.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/hypervisors/tests.py'], 'message': "Fix TemplateSyntaxError at hypervisors view

If somehow nova API service-list isn't available, listing
hypervisors at /admin/hypervisors/ ends with TemplateSyntaxError.

Expected result is that the page should load but user will
see empty list and error message.

This fix is based on idea found in other views:

openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/...
images/views.py
aggregate/views.py
falvors/views.pu

that on any exception while getting data (get_data), we just
return empty list and handle exception to display error message.

Closes-Bug: #1392316

Change-Id: Ia665111185abecab6a96e6c72a6088cf2fa2e02b
(cherry picked from commit 5c4e827568be429ac5227a950c9f24c578ca8fd8)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix TemplateSyntaxError at hypervisors view

If somehow nova API service-list isn't available, listing
hypervisors at /admin/hypervisors/ ends with TemplateSyntaxError.

Expected result is that the page should load but user will
see empty list and error message.

This fix is based on idea found in other views:

openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/...
images/views.py
aggregate/views.py
falvors/views.pu

that on any exception while getting data (get_data), we just
return empty list and handle exception to display error message.

Closes-Bug: #1392316

Change-Id: Ia665111185abecab6a96e6c72a6088cf2fa2e02b
(cherry picked from commit 5c4e827568be429ac5227a950c9f24c578ca8fd8)

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-07-14 20:23:08.000000000', 'files': ['reference/projects.yaml', 'reference/tags/index.rst', 'reference/tags/vulnerability_managed.rst'], 'message': 'Add and apply vulnerability:managed tag

The VMT is building out automation and reporting for vulnerability
management processes in order to better accomodate the rapid growth
of the OpenStack ecosystem. In an order to scale consumability of
its processes beyond its current charter and capacity, a formal
acknowledgement of the list of source code repositories directly
handled by the VMT (rather than managed independently by individual
project teams) is best maintained through application of a
governance-related tag.

Change-Id: I1260839b50b6a5ff57a6649e419094f2d4f7f877
'}]
commit_message:
Add and apply vulnerability:managed tag

The VMT is building out automation and reporting for vulnerability
management processes in order to better accomodate the rapid growth
of the OpenStack ecosystem. In an order to scale consumability of
its processes beyond its current charter and capacity, a formal
acknowledgement of the list of source code repositories directly
handled by the VMT (rather than managed independently by individual
project teams) is best maintained through application of a
governance-related tag.

Change-Id: I1260839b50b6a5ff57a6649e419094f2d4f7f877

This reverts commit 27f7fe52fefcb81c5fe01736841d7a20149caf02

Logstash can't distinguish traces from errors now so we have
no way to do multi-line queries, which is bad.

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-14 15:57:16.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt', 'novaclient/tests/unit/v2/test_shell.py'], 'message': "Updated from global requirements

Issue found with mock 1.1.3:

Because of the test inheritance test_keypair_import is getting called
3 times. It appears that the mock for open builtins is getting torn
down after it's first use, and not correctly built again on subsequent calls.

In the gate, this is a race, because we have 3 tests and 8 workers,
and this will only fail if 2 or more of the tests happen to be
allocated to the same worker. This can be reproduced locally with:

  tox -e py27 -- --concurrency=1

Converting this to the context manager usage of mock appears to
resolve the issue.

Co-Authored-By: Sean Dague <sean@dague.net>

Related-Bug: https://github.com/testing-cabal/mock/issues/280

Change-Id: I9a87375d2eb6c7cf7b9124b2095a5a4bcc8e7bf3
"}]
commit_message:
Updated from global requirements

Issue found with mock 1.1.3:

Because of the test inheritance test_keypair_import is getting called
3 times. It appears that the mock for open builtins is getting torn
down after it's first use, and not correctly built again on subsequent calls.

In the gate, this is a race, because we have 3 tests and 8 workers,
and this will only fail if 2 or more of the tests happen to be
allocated to the same worker. This can be reproduced locally with:

  tox -e py27 -- --concurrency=1

Converting this to the context manager usage of mock appears to
resolve the issue.

Co-Authored-By: Sean Dague <sean@dague.net>

Related-Bug: https://github.com/testing-cabal/mock/issues/280

Change-Id: I9a87375d2eb6c7cf7b9124b2095a5a4bcc8e7bf3

revisions:
[{'number': 13, 'created': '2015-07-09 13:40:45.000000000', 'files': ['nova/exception.py', 'nova/tests/unit/db/test_db_api.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': "Implement compare-and-swap for instance update

This patch reworks nova.db.sqlalchemy.api._instance_update to remove a
race condition that exists in a critical section of code that
retrieves the instance record from the database, does some checks of
both the new values and existing values of instance fields, and then
tries to update the database with the new values.

We update the value using update_on_match, which does an optimistic,
atomic, lock-free, compare-and-swap on the object. If the update
fails, we do some additional checks to determine the specific error,
which maintains the previous behaviour. There's an exceptionally
small chance of a race when checking for an error if the expected
update conditions were not met when we tried the UPDATE, but were met
when we fetch the instance for error checking. We handle this by
raising a new error, InstanceUpdateConflict.

_instance_update() is simplified by having it return only the updated
instance_ref. instance_update_and_get_original() is updated to fetch
the old value itself before calling _instance_update().

Closes-bug: #1297375
Change-Id: I9cd0f4b620e639b238555983bf6d58deafbaefeb
"}]
commit_message:
Implement compare-and-swap for instance update

This patch reworks nova.db.sqlalchemy.api._instance_update to remove a
race condition that exists in a critical section of code that
retrieves the instance record from the database, does some checks of
both the new values and existing values of instance fields, and then
tries to update the database with the new values.

We update the value using update_on_match, which does an optimistic,
atomic, lock-free, compare-and-swap on the object. If the update
fails, we do some additional checks to determine the specific error,
which maintains the previous behaviour. There's an exceptionally
small chance of a race when checking for an error if the expected
update conditions were not met when we tried the UPDATE, but were met
when we fetch the instance for error checking. We handle this by
raising a new error, InstanceUpdateConflict.

_instance_update() is simplified by having it return only the updated
instance_ref. instance_update_and_get_original() is updated to fetch
the old value itself before calling _instance_update().

Closes-bug: #1297375
Change-Id: I9cd0f4b620e639b238555983bf6d58deafbaefeb

commit_message:
Remove the --dhcp option to network list

The --dhcp option lists agents, not networks.  This does not make
a lot of sense.  Another command should be created to list agents.

BackwardsIncompatibleImpact
Closes-Bug: #1472613

Change-Id: I5ecfe3fc046a07eb64a4dabd41dbd99de7c2215f

Blair', 'email': 'jim@acmegating.com', 'username': 'corvus'}, {'_account_id': 2, 'name': 'Monty Taylor', 'email': 'mordred@inaugust.com', 'username': 'mordred'}, {'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7, 'name': 'Jay Pipes', 'email': 'jaypipes@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaypipes'}, {'_account_id': 308, 'name': 'Thierry Carrez', 'email': 'thierry@openstack.org', 'username': 'ttx'}, {'_account_id': 964, 'name': 'Anne Gentle', 'email': 'annegentle@justwriteclick.com', 'username': 'annegentle'}, {'_account_id': 970, 'name': 'Dean Troyer', 'email': 'dtroyer@gmail.com', 'username': 'dtroyer'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 2592, 'name': 'Mark McClain', 'email': 'mark@mcclain.xyz', 'username': 'markmcclain'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 2889, 'name': 'Aeva Black', 'email': 'aeva.online@gmail.com', 'username': 'tenbrae'}, {'_account_id': 4190, 'name': 'lifeless', 'email': 'robertc@robertcollins.net', 'username': 'lifeless'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-09 14:29:08.000000000', 'files': ['reference/projects.yaml', 'reference/tags/index.rst', 'reference/tags/release_cycle-with-intermediary.rst', 'reference/tags/release_none.rst', 'reference/tags/release_at-6mo-cycle-end.rst', 'reference/tags/release_cycle-with-milestones.rst', 'reference/tags/release_independent.rst', 'reference/tags/release_managed.rst'], 'message': 'Redefine release tags to match new models

In the Liberty cycle we support new release models, which made
the current release tags taxonomy a bit unusable.

Switch to a new model taxonomy where a repository may only have
one release model:
* release:cycle-with-milestones (think keystone or nova)
* release:cycle-with-intermediary (think swift or libraries)
* release:independent (think zuul)
* release:none (think: openstack/governance)

This will clarify which release models actually exist, and
more clearly communicate to our users (and our tooling) which
model each repository follows.

We also adapt the wording of the release:managed tag to avoid
excluding swift or Oslo libraries (which do not follow the
development milestones model) from being managed if the release
team accepts them.

Change-Id: Ie58a370f2a189a421040535b99949f3fac9eb4eb
'}]
commit_message:
Redefine release tags to match new models

In the Liberty cycle we support new release models, which made
the current release tags taxonomy a bit unusable.

Switch to a new model taxonomy where a repository may only have
one release model:
* release:cycle-with-milestones (think keystone or nova)
* release:cycle-with-intermediary (think swift or libraries)
* release:independent (think zuul)
* release:none (think: openstack/governance)

This will clarify which release models actually exist, and
more clearly communicate to our users (and our tooling) which
model each repository follows.

We also adapt the wording of the release:managed tag to avoid
excluding swift or Oslo libraries (which do not follow the
development milestones model) from being managed if the release
team accepts them.

Change-Id: Ie58a370f2a189a421040535b99949f3fac9eb4eb

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-07-10 14:50:42.000000000', 'files': ['reference/projects.yaml', 'reference/tags/compute_starter_kit.rst'], 'message': 'Add neutron to starter-kit:compute

While nova-network is still supported because of concerns about
migration paths, neutron should be as strongly recommended for any new
deployments as is humanly possible so that we can ultimately get
ourselves out of the mess of having two network stacks.

Since starter-kit:compute is intended to help point a finger at what
people should install when trying things out, we should certainly not
imply that they install a network stack that we plan on deleting in the
future. Neutron in provider-vlan/linuxbridge mode is dead simple in not
requiring openvswitch or SDN, and still gets new users a cloud that is
upwards flexible with the future.

Change-Id: I91bce1bcc51121a8a577cff478fdc91002b689b4
'}]
commit_message:
Add neutron to starter-kit:compute

While nova-network is still supported because of concerns about
migration paths, neutron should be as strongly recommended for any new
deployments as is humanly possible so that we can ultimately get
ourselves out of the mess of having two network stacks.

Since starter-kit:compute is intended to help point a finger at what
people should install when trying things out, we should certainly not
imply that they install a network stack that we plan on deleting in the
future. Neutron in provider-vlan/linuxbridge mode is dead simple in not
requiring openvswitch or SDN, and still gets new users a cloud that is
upwards flexible with the future.

Change-Id: I91bce1bcc51121a8a577cff478fdc91002b689b4

commit_message:
WIP - injectjs - a Django command to inject JS

This Djanog command automatically discovers and injects
JavaScript code to html page.

NOTE:
This work is in progress, still working on how to pass in
arguments.

It is working now with the hard coded data. To place with
it, one needs to run below commands in terminal before
starting/resatrting web server:

> source .venv/bin/activate
> ./manage.py injectjs

Change-Id: Ifd05484a860ba6977dc4e9d43df37bfbbb31a30d
Partially-Implements: blueprint auto-js-file-finding

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-14 09:02:44.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Disable python3 tests failing due to Routes < 2.0

At now, global-requirements has an entry:
Routes!=2.0,!=2.1,>=1.12.3
and this leads to Routes < 2.0 which is not compatible
with Python 3. This blocks updating of global requirements [1].
To avoid the situation, this commit disables python 3 related
error due to Routes version.

Closes-Bug: #1474266
Related to blueprint neutron-python3

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/182746/

Change-Id: If5e6355505361cbefe04487b6d47ab9cc6ba861c'}]
commit_message:
Disable python3 tests failing due to Routes < 2.0

At now, global-requirements has an entry:
Routes!=2.0,!=2.1,>=1.12.3
and this leads to Routes < 2.0 which is not compatible
with Python 3. This blocks updating of global requirements [1].
To avoid the situation, this commit disables python 3 related
error due to Routes version.

Closes-Bug: #1474266
Related to blueprint neutron-python3

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/182746/

Change-Id: If5e6355505361cbefe04487b6d47ab9cc6ba861c

commit_message:
osd: fix pattern when matching ${data}

It could give false positive e.g. if looking for /srv/data while
/srv/data1 already exists.

Change-Id: I42a20a9d871bc3033b42693eefca05ba73766d33

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-07-10 14:18:27.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/ipam/requests.py', 'neutron/db/ipam_pluggable_backend.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_ipam_pluggable_backend.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/ipam/test_requests.py'], 'message': "Add Pluggable IPAM Backend Part 1

Add methods for allocating/deallocating ips using IPAM driver.
Methods are covered by unit tests and currently used only by them.

For pluggable IPAM case ipam driver may execute calls to third-party servers.
It means we can't rely on database transaction rollback in case of failure.
So if any bulk ip allocation/deallocation fails rollback should be done
on third-party servers as well.
Any completed ip allocation should be explicitly deallocated in case of
failure, and vise versa for failure on deallocation.
Try-except block is used to do manual rollback actions.
After rollback actions are done, exception is reraised and local db
transaction rollback occurs.

Pluggable IPAM was divided into two parts to keep review size small.
Following patches are expected to use these methods for ip address
allocation.

Partially-Implements: blueprint neutron-ipam

Change-Id: I8bb836c9883e189b065698ae0a862b2d909d5cbf
"}]
commit_message:
Add Pluggable IPAM Backend Part 1

Add methods for allocating/deallocating ips using IPAM driver.
Methods are covered by unit tests and currently used only by them.

For pluggable IPAM case ipam driver may execute calls to third-party servers.
It means we can't rely on database transaction rollback in case of failure.
So if any bulk ip allocation/deallocation fails rollback should be done
on third-party servers as well.
Any completed ip allocation should be explicitly deallocated in case of
failure, and vise versa for failure on deallocation.
Try-except block is used to do manual rollback actions.
After rollback actions are done, exception is reraised and local db
transaction rollback occurs.

Pluggable IPAM was divided into two parts to keep review size small.
Following patches are expected to use these methods for ip address
allocation.

Partially-Implements: blueprint neutron-ipam

Change-Id: I8bb836c9883e189b065698ae0a862b2d909d5cbf

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-14 18:09:06.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/storyboard.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/specs-jobs.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Always use gate- instead of check- (m-s*)

Change pipeline name to only use "gate", we do not need the
differentiation between check and gate anymore.
This changes the pipelines configured via files in jenkins/jobs/[m-s]*
(excluding projects.yaml).

Change-Id: Ib75f491924d75f4892a0ff2e4871b40c6e56522b
'}]
commit_message:
Always use gate- instead of check- (m-s*)

Change pipeline name to only use "gate", we do not need the
differentiation between check and gate anymore.
This changes the pipelines configured via files in jenkins/jobs/[m-s]*
(excluding projects.yaml).

Change-Id: Ib75f491924d75f4892a0ff2e4871b40c6e56522b

commit_message:
Adding test for Try, Except, Pass

Ignoring errors is bad in general, you should at least log it. This
is a security problem as increased exceptions from a service may
indicate attempts to break/fuzz it.

Change-Id: I8f6ad98a3f3dccb89d15f2e50beeaf4ce093323a

[{'number': 28, 'created': '2015-07-09 18:20:40.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/migration/models/head.py', 'neutron/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/15be73214821_add_bgp_speaker_model_data.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_l3.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/services/bgp_speaker/__init__.py', 'neutron/db/bgp_speaker_db.py', 'neutron/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/HEAD', 'neutron/services/bgp_speaker/__init__.py', 'neutron/services/bgp_speaker/plugin.py', 'neutron/extensions/bgp_speaker.py', 'neutron/plugins/common/constants.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/services/bgp_speaker/test_bgp_speaker.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_bgp_speaker.py', 'tools/check_unit_test_structure.sh', 'setup.cfg', 'etc/policy.json', 'neutron/tests/etc/policy.json'], 'message': '[WIP] BGP Dynamic Routing: introduce entities and model

This is the first patch to provide BGP dynamic route
advertisement functionality in Neutron.
This patch provides a new extension ("bgp_speaker") with
support for basic CRUD on bgp_speaker and bgp_peer, as
well as bgp_speaker-bgp_peer and bgp_speaker-network
bindings.
An admin user can create BgpSpeakers and configure
peering entities (BgpPeers) for BgpSpeakers. BgpSpeaker
to BgpPeer association is n-to-n. An admin user can
also associate networks with BgpSpeakers. Relationship
between BgpSpeaker and Network is 1-to-n.
This patch provides BGP-related functionality only to
admin users.

Change-Id: I33e039df1bdd14af9ab83d9120595adc4ab2f38e
Partially-Implements: blueprint bgp-dynamic-routing
Co-Authored-By: Ryan Tidwell <ryan.tidwell@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Jaume Devesa <devvesa@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Vikram Choudhary <vikram.choudhary@huawei.com>
'}]
commit_message:
[WIP] BGP Dynamic Routing: introduce entities and model

This is the first patch to provide BGP dynamic route
advertisement functionality in Neutron.
This patch provides a new extension ("bgp_speaker") with
support for basic CRUD on bgp_speaker and bgp_peer, as
well as bgp_speaker-bgp_peer and bgp_speaker-network
bindings.
An admin user can create BgpSpeakers and configure
peering entities (BgpPeers) for BgpSpeakers. BgpSpeaker
to BgpPeer association is n-to-n. An admin user can
also associate networks with BgpSpeakers. Relationship
between BgpSpeaker and Network is 1-to-n.
This patch provides BGP-related functionality only to
admin users.

Change-Id: I33e039df1bdd14af9ab83d9120595adc4ab2f38e
Partially-Implements: blueprint bgp-dynamic-routing
Co-Authored-By: Ryan Tidwell <ryan.tidwell@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Jaume Devesa <devvesa@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Vikram Choudhary <vikram.choudhary@huawei.com>
